assessment.title: Identifying Circuits of the Cardiovascular System: Extra Questions

body.p: The above image illustrates the , which transports blood between the heart and lungs. The carry away from the heart to exchange gases in the lungs.

response.feedback: Correct. The pulmonary circuit transports blood into the lungs for the exchange of gases; carbon dioxide is removed from the blood and oxygen is added to it.
This is not the best choice. Blood flows to all tissues and organs of the body through vessels. This circuit of vessels specifically carries blood between the heart and lungs.

Incorrect. The respiratory system includes the lungs, where oxygen from the air moves into the blood and carbon dioxide is removed. The respiratory system, though, does not direct the flow of blood. A circuit of vessels controls the flow of blood into and out of the lungs.
Incorrect. The systemic circuit routes the flow of blood between the heart and all organs and tissues of the body except the lungs.

part.hint: Notice this image shows the heart and lungs.
This circulatory system obtains oxygenated blood for the body.

response.feedback: Correct. Pulmonary arteries direct the flow of blood from the heart into the lungs for the exchange of gases: carbon dioxide is removed and oxygen supplied to the blood.
Incorrect. Pulmonary veins route oxygen-enriched blood from the lungs into the heart.

Incorrect. Veins carry blood into the heart: Oxygen-depleted blood is transported through veins from the body into the heart. Oxygen-enriched blood flows through the pulmonary veins from the lungs into the heart.
Incorrect. Oxygenated blood flows through the aorta from the left side of the heart into the body.

part.hint: These particular vessels carry blood to the lungs to pick up oxygen for the body and release carbon dioxide waste generated by cell metabolism.
These vessels connect to the right side of the heart in order to transport blood away from the heart and into the lungs.

response.feedback: Correct. Usually arteries carry oxygen-rich blood, but pulmonary arteries carry oxygen-poor blood. Remember that "arteries" go "away" from the heart.
Incorrect. Usually arteries carry oxygen-rich blood, but pulmonary arteries carry oxygen-poor blood. Remember that "arteries" go "away" from the heart.
Incorrect. Oxygen is exchanged in the lungs.
Incorrect. Plasma is carried also, but oxygen is poorly soluble in water and plasma.

part.hint: This is the condition of the blood after it has traveled through the body providing oxygen and nutrients, and accumulating waste from cell metabolism.

body.p: The image above illustrates the two major circuits of the cardiovascular system. Please complete the following sentences.

The heart pumps to send blood . The pumps blood between the heart and all organs in the body, except for the lungs. In this circuit of vessels carry oxygenated blood away from the heart and carry oxygen-depleted blood back to the heart.

response.feedback: Correct. Blood in the circulatory system moves through arteries, veins and capillaries.
Incorrect. The circulatory system is responsible for moving fluids to most of the body tissues, but most blood is contained in vessels.
Incorrect. The circulatory system does move blood to the digestive system, but also moves it throughout the rest of the body, and always through vessels.
Incorrect. The circulatory system does move blood to the skin, but also moves it throughout the rest of the body, and always through vessels.

part.hint: These structures carry blood to specific organs.

response.feedback: Correct. The systemic circulatory system routes blood flow between the heart and all parts of the body except the lungs, to provide oxygen and collect waste from cell metabolism.
Incorrect. The pulmonary circulatory system directs blood flow between the heart and lungs.
Incorrect. The respiratory system includes the lungs, where oxygen from the air moves into the blood and carbon dioxide is removed.
Incorrect. The digestive system does not control the flow of blood; it breaks down food and water, providing nutrients for absorption into the blood.

part.hint: This circuit of blood vessels covers the entire body except for one organ.

response.feedback: Correct. Arteries transport oxygen-enriched blood from the heart to all organs and tissues of the body except the lungs.

Not quite. Red blood cells contain the oxygen obtained during gas exchange in the lungs, but red blood cells are only one of the components of blood. You are asked to identify the blood vessels that transport oxygenated blood and all of its components.
Incorrect. The pulmonary veins carry oxygenated blood from the lungs into the heart.
Incorrect. Veins return oxygen-poor blood back to the heart after the blood has coursed through the body and accumulated waste from cell metabolism.

part.hint: Arteries carry oxygenated blood away from the heart and veins carry oxygen-depleted blood back to the heart.

response.feedback: Correct. Veins are the vessels that transport oxygen-poor blood back to the heart after the blood has traveled throughout the body providing oxygen and accumulating waste from cell metabolism.
Incorrect. Arteries transport oxygen-enriched blood away from the heart to the body.
Incorrect. Pulmonary arteries are the vessels that carry oxygen-poor blood away from the heart and into the lungs for the exchange of gases.
Incorrect. White blood cells are only one component of the blood that travels through all blood vessels.

part.hint: Veins are under lower pressure since they are returning to the heart.
Arteries and veins are the major types of blood vessels. Arteries carry blood away from the heart.
